jobs.title: GTM Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Aries

Aries is a rapidly-scaling, founder-led group of profitable software companies operating at the heart of the $50B+ cloud ecosystem. We unify niche B2B SaaS businesses under a shared AI and growth platform — unlocking visibility, velocity, and value across our portfolio.

With a permanent capital base and approximately $200M invested annually, we’re building a new model for software scale — focused on long-term value, not short-term hype.

The Role

We’re hiring a GTM Engineer to build and automate outbound sales systems across our portfolio. This is a technical growth role for someone who thrives at the intersection of sales, ops, and engineering. You’ll design workflows, connect tools, and build scalable systems that power lead generation and outbound at 0-1 SaaS companies.

Think: part automation architect, part growth hacker, part sales technologist. You’ll work directly with founders and early sales teams to deliver practical GTM infrastructure — fast.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design and implement outbound campaign systems using tools like Apollo, Clearbit, HubSpot, and Zapier

  • Working closely with product & AI teams

  • Automate lead enrichment, list building, CRM updates, and engagement workflows

  • Integrate data sources (e.g., LinkedIn, web scraping, enrichment APIs) into campaign-ready pipelines

  • Build internal tools, scripts, or lightweight apps to improve GTM execution and visibility

  • Collaborate with sales and marketing operators to translate strategy into tooling

  • Document reusable playbooks, code snippets, and systems for use across the Aries platform

About You

  • 2–5+ years of experience in sales engineering, growth ops, or similar technical GTM roles

  • Proficient with modern sales and marketing tools (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce, Apollo, Clay, Zapier, Make)

  • Strong working knowledge of APIs, webhooks, and automation tools (e.g., Python, JavaScript, or low-code platforms)

  • Able to move fast and iterate — from prototype to production in days, not months

  • Strong communicator who can bridge GTM and technical teams

  • Based in London, with flexibility to work from our office several days per week

Bonus Experience

  • Experience supporting early-stage or founder-led sales teams

  • Background in data engineering, scripting, or workflow automation

  • Familiarity with enrichment tools (e.g., Clearbit, People Data Labs, Phantombuster) and web scraping techniques

Why Aries

  • Build high-impact systems across a portfolio of ambitious SaaS companies

  • Operate in a fast-moving, collaborative environment with founders and operators

  • Develop and scale the GTM stack that powers multi-million-dollar growth engines

  • Competitive compensation and equity aligned with the scale of your work

    Let’s Talk

    If you're a builder at heart, with a vision for how sales can transform business, we'd love to speak. This is more than a job — it's a chance to help build the future of cloud software.

    📩 Reach out directly or apply here to start the conversation.

jobs.title: Investment Associate
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Aries

Aries is a rapidly-scaling, next-generation software group purpose-built to scale founder-led, mission-critical SaaS companies at the heart of the $50B+ cloud ecosystem. We unify niche B2B SaaS businesses under Aries' AI and Growth Platform - unlocking visibility, velocity, and value across our portfolio. With a permanent capital base and ~$200M invested annually, we’re building a new model for software scale focused on long-term value.


The Role

We're hiring an Investment Associate to help source, evaluate, and execute software acquisitions. This is a high-impact role at the centre of Aries’ M&A engine. You'll work directly with founders, the leadership team, and external stakeholders across the full deal lifecycle - from sourcing to execution to post-acquisition value creation.
You’ll gain hands-on exposure across private equity investing, operational strategy, and software growth — within a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment.


Key Responsibilities

  • Source and evaluate software acquisition opportunities across Europe and beyond

  • Conduct financial analysis, market research, and valuation modelling

  • Lead and manage due diligence across legal, financial, commercial, and technical areas

  • Support investment memos, committee prep, deal structuring, and negotiation

  • Collaborate with portfolio companies post-acquisition on growth and integration

  • Build sourcing relationships and strengthen Aries’ investment pipeline

What We’re Looking For

  • 2–5 years of experience in investment banking, private equity, VC, or corporate development

  • Strong financial modeling and valuation skills (experience with SaaS preferred)

  • Proven experience leading or supporting deal processes from end to end

  • Strategic thinker with an entrepreneurial mindset and commercial acumen

  • Excellent communicator with strong stakeholder engagement skills

  • Ability to thrive in a high-velocity, ownership-driven environment

Why Join Aries

  • Help build one of Europe’s most ambitious software platforms

  • Work on live deals with a team of experienced investors and operators

  • Shape the playbook for how we acquire, scale, and integrate SaaS companies

  • High autonomy, high learning curve, and high impact

Apply now to join Aries Global and help us reshape how software companies scale in the AI-native era.

jobs.title: Head of Engineering
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Aries

Aries is a rapidly-scaling, founder-led group of profitable software companies at the heart of the $50B+ cloud ecosystem, now transforming the landscape through a shared AI and growth infrastructure. We unify niche SaaS companies under a central platform that unlocks visibility, velocity, and value across our portfolio.

With a permanent capital base and ~$200M invested annually in profitable software, we’re not just chasing trends - we’re building enduring value.

The Role

We’re looking for a Founding Head of Engineering to lead the charge in building our central technology platform - someone who thrives in high-feedback, fast-build environments and wants to have a lasting impact on an ambitious company from the ground up.

You’ll architect, build, and manage the team responsible for prototyping and deploying tools that integrate and supercharge performance across our SaaS group. From stitching together 3rd-party APIs to deploying AI agents that drive growth — this is a rare opportunity to shape both product and team from day one.

What You’ll Do

  • Build the Core Aries Platform: Drive the design and development of tools and systems that unify and scale portfolio operations.

  • Lead Engineering Execution: Hire, grow, and mentor a central team of high-performing engineers (~20 over 12 months).

  • Own Agent Development: Lead development of autonomous and semi-autonomous agents, especially for outbound and inbound GTM workflows.

  • Collaborate Across Functions: Work closely with Product, Data, and AI teams to take ideas from concept to working product - fast.

  • Integrate & Automate: Stitch together best-in-class tools and platforms via APIs and state machines, creating fast-feedback systems.

  • Champion Engineering Excellence: Set technical standards, introduce best practices, and create a culture of velocity, ownership, and continuous learning.

What We’re Looking For

  • Proven track record in engineering leadership within high-growth B2B SaaS environments

  • Strong builder: Able to go from 0→1 rapidly, with an eye for experimentation and iteration

  • Technical breadth across backend, APIs, systems integration, and ideally some experience with AI workflows or agents

  • Experience managing high-output engineering teams and shipping complex systems in production

  • A hands-on leader who can write code when needed, but knows how to scale their impact through others

  • Deep product sensibility and bias for impact; you’re excited by the intersection of product, growth, and engineering

  • A systems thinker: able to map and execute across tools, data flows, and operational complexity

Why Join Aries

  • Join at the founding stage of a company with rocketship growth and deep resources

  • Work with a world-class team of founders, engineers, investors, and operators

  • Play a key role in shaping the technology stack and culture across a group that’s redefining how software businesses grow

  • Access a platform that spans multiple profitable SaaS companies — the scale and impact potential is massive

Let’s Talk

If you're a builder at heart, with a vision for how engineering can transform business, we'd love to speak. This is more than a job — it's a chance to help architect the future of cloud software.

📩 Reach out directly or apply here to start the conversation.

The Role

We’re looking for a high-energy, ambitious SDR to join our central commercial team. You’ll help drive outbound sales and pipeline growth across a portfolio of B2B SaaS companies.
You’ll work closely with founders, marketers, and sales leads — crafting outreach, booking meetings, and shaping how we scale outbound across products and markets.

Responsibilities

  • Research and engage prospects across email, phone, and LinkedIn

  • Craft tailored outreach messages for different personas

  • Book qualified meetings and contribute to team pipeline goals

  • Collaborate with marketing and sales to refine targeting and messaging

  • Use tools like Apollo, HubSpot, and LinkedIn Sales Navigator

  • Test and improve outbound strategies across brands

Requirements

  • 1–2 years of SDR/BDR experience in B2B SaaS or tech (or strong motivation and communication skills if earlier stage)

  • Excellent written and verbal communication

  • Highly organised, persistent, and motivated by results

  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment

  • Tech-savvy and eager to learn new tools and methods

  • Entrepreneurial mindset with a strong sense of ownership

jobs.title: Analytics Engineer Intern
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Aries

Aries is a rapidly-scaling, next-generation software group purpose-built to scale founder-led, mission-critical SaaS companies at the heart of the $50B+ cloud ecosystem. We unify niche B2B SaaS businesses under Aries' AI and Growth Platform - unlocking visibility, velocity, and value across our portfolio. With a permanent capital base and ~$200M invested annually, we’re building a new model for software scale focused on long-term value.

We're looking for a curious, motivated intern to join our Analytics Engineering team. If you’re excited about transforming raw data into powerful insights using modern cloud data tools, this internship is a great opportunity to gain real-world, production-grade experience.

About the Role

As an Analytics Engineer Intern, you’ll help us build the foundation of our data products, reliable data models and intuitive dashboards. Your contributions will ensure business users can confidently take actions and access metrics that matter.

Responsibilities

  • Build and maintain Data models and Products that power critical dashboards, processes and reporting tools.

  • Help manage and optimize data pipelines in dbt & Snowflake, our primary data warehouse.

  • Collaborate with analysts and business stakeholders to understand their data needs and design intuitive, self-serve solutions.

  • Design and maintain dashboards in Sigma that empower non-technical users.

  • Assist with documentation, data testing, and quality checks to ensure data integrity.

  • Work closely with the data engineering team on schema design, performance, and pipeline best practices.

Qualifications

  • Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a different field, with strong interest and experience in data.

Required Skills

  • Strong SQL skills and an understanding of relational databases.

  • Familiarity with Python or other coding language.

  • Exposure to Snowflake or another cloud data warehouse.

  • Familiarity with dashboarding tools like Sigma, Tableau, or Looker.

  • Interest in data modeling, fast moving environment, and analytical thinking.

  • Good communication skills and a collaborative mindset.

Preferred Skills

  • Exposure to real-world data workflows and business use cases.

  • Hands-on experience and ability to build a modern techstack.

  • Mentorship from experienced analytics engineers.

  • Insight into how high-growth companies use data to drive decisions.

  • Opportunities to contribute to projects that get used across the business.

Internship Logistics

  • Start Date: Flexible (ideal: August–September 2025)

  • Length: 3–6 months, with potential to extend

  • Application Deadline: Rolling

  • Location: London

How to Apply

Send your resume and a short note explaining:

  • Why you’re excited about analytics engineering.

  • Any projects or coursework where you’ve used SQL, Snowflake, or dashboarding tools.

Equal Opportunity Statement

We are committed to diversity and inclusivity in our hiring practices.

jobs.title: AI Platform Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Aries

Aries is a rapidly-scaling, next-generation software group purpose-built to scale founder-led, mission-critical SaaS companies at the heart of the $50B+ cloud ecosystem. We unify niche B2B SaaS businesses under Aries' AI and Growth Platform - unlocking visibility, velocity, and value across our portfolio. With a permanent capital base and ~$200M invested annually, we’re building a new model for software scale focused on long-term value.

The Role: AI Platform Engineer

As an AI Platform Engineer at Aries, you’ll help design, build, and evolve the internal AI platform that powers how we go to market and run our business. This includes orchestrating intelligent agents, stitching together third-party systems, and enabling fast iteration on experimental workflows that scale across the company.

You’ll work at the intersection of backend engineering, infrastructure, and AI application design—collaborating closely with engineering, GTM, and operations teams to build a one-stop platform for deploying, managing, and scaling AI-driven agents.

What You’ll Do

Build the Core Platform: Develop foundational systems that support portfolio company onboarding and drive intelligent GTM agents for outbound, inbound, and operational workflows.

Deploy and Monitor Agents: Design infrastructure to train, run, monitor, and evaluate AI agents from prototype to production.

Stitch Systems Together: Integrate third-party tools via APIs and state machines, enabling seamless experimentation and rapid deployment of AI-driven processes.

Drive Iteration: Enable fast experimentation by supporting the rollout of lightweight agents, and promote successful patterns into the productized platform.

Ensure Platform Reliability: Own system observability, performance, and security across agent pipelines and infrastructure.

Collaborate Across Functions: Work closely with GTM, engineering, and operations stakeholders to generalize field needs into scalable platform capabilities.

Build for the Future: Help expand Aries into a core AI operating system that will eventually drive the lion’s share of company strategy.

What We’re Looking For

  • 3–6+ years of experience in platform engineering, ML infrastructure, or backend development

  • Strong Python skills (Go, Java, or TypeScript experience a bonus)

  • Proven experience building and operating distributed systems and APIs

  • Familiarity with tools like Kubernetes, Terraform, Postgres, Redis, Airflow, or LangChain

  • Experience deploying or integrating LLMs or agent-based systems in production

  • Excited to bridge systems, build reusable tooling, and ship with speed and ownership

  • Passionate about infrastructure that creates leverage for the rest of the business

Why Aries

  • Help shape a platform that enables AI-driven automation across every business function

  • Work on real-world systems used daily by GTM, recruiting, and finance teams

  • Collaborate with a sharp, high-ownership team solving high-leverage problems

  • Join early and contribute to the foundational infrastructure of a rapidly-scaling company

Let’s Build

If you're energised by the idea of building agent infrastructure, working across AI and ops, and creating systems with real impact - we’d love to hear from you.

We unify niche B2B SaaS businesses under Aries' AI and Growth Platform - unlocking visibility, velocity, and value across our portfolio. With a permanent capital base and ~$200M invested annually, we’re building a new model for software scale focused on long-term value.

The Role
We’re looking for a Director of Go-To-Market Strategy to work directly inside our portfolio companies — leading early commercial efforts as an embedded operator. You’ll be hands-on in sales: prospecting, pitching, and closing deals like an AE, while also building scalable go-to-market foundations that companies can grow on.
You’ll partner closely with founders and leadership teams to identify ICPs, shape messaging, and turn early traction into repeatable revenue. This is a high-impact role for someone who thrives in zero-to-one environments and wants to build multiple revenue engines from the ground up.


Key Responsibilities

  • Own early sales motions: generate pipeline, lead demos, manage objections, and close deals

  • Develop outbound and inbound strategies tailored to each company’s market and maturity

  • Build GTM systems and tooling (CRM, reporting, outreach automation)

  • Collaborate with product and marketing to align positioning and messaging

  • Transition successful playbooks to early hires and support team ramp-up

  • Document best practices into reusable templates and toolkits for the broader portfolio

About You

  • 5–8+ years in B2B SaaS sales or GTM leadership, ideally with early-stage experience

  • Proven track record selling to technical and/or enterprise buyers

  • Comfortable operating independently across different products and industries

  • Strong communication, structured thinking, and high execution velocity

  • Based in London, with flexibility to work from our office several days per week

Nice to Have

  • Experience as an early sales hire at a startup/in region

  • Familiarity with tools like HubSpot, Salesforce, Apollo, Clearbit, Notion, Clay

Why Aries

  • Sell and scale across a portfolio of high-potential SaaS businesses

  • Work directly with founders and early teams on real business problems

  • Learn and build across multiple verticals, playbooks, and growth stages

jobs.title: Investment Associate
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Aries

Aries is a rapidly-scaling, next-generation software group purpose-built to scale founder-led, mission-critical SaaS companies at the heart of the $50B+ cloud ecosystem. We unify niche B2B SaaS businesses under Aries' AI and Growth Platform - unlocking visibility, velocity, and value across our portfolio. With a permanent capital base and ~$200M invested annually, we’re building a new model for software scale focused on long-term value.

The Role

We're hiring an Investment Associate to help source, evaluate, and execute software acquisitions. This is a high-impact role at the centre of Aries’ M&A engine. You'll work directly with founders, the leadership team, and external stakeholders across the full deal lifecycle - from sourcing to execution to post-acquisition value creation.

You’ll gain hands-on exposure across private equity investing, operational strategy, and software growth — within a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment.

Key Responsibilities

Source and evaluate software acquisition opportunities across the US and beyond

Conduct financial analysis, market research, and valuation modelling

Lead and manage due diligence across legal, financial, commercial, and technical areas

Support investment memos, committee prep, deal structuring, and negotiation

Collaborate with portfolio companies post-acquisition on growth and integration

Build sourcing relationships and strengthen Aries’ investment pipeline

What We’re Looking For

2–5 years of experience in investment banking, private equity, VC, or corporate development

Strong financial modelling and valuation skills (experience with SaaS preferred)

Proven experience leading or supporting deal processes from end to end

Strategic thinker with an entrepreneurial mindset and commercial acumen

Excellent communicator with strong stakeholder engagement skills

Ability to thrive in a high-velocity, ownership-driven environment

Why Join Aries

Help build one of the world's most ambitious software platforms

Work on live deals with a team of experienced investors and operators

Shape the playbook for how we acquire, scale, and integrate SaaS companies

High autonomy, high learning curve, and high impact

Competitive compensation with clear progression in a growing team

Apply now to join Aries Global and help us reshape how software companies scale in the AI-native era.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Aries

Aries is a rapidly-scaling, next-generation software group purpose-built to scale founder-led, mission-critical SaaS companies at the heart of the $50B+ cloud ecosystem. We unify niche B2B SaaS businesses under Aries' AI and Growth Platform - unlocking visibility, velocity, and value across our portfolio. With a permanent capital base and ~$200M invested annually, we’re building a new model for software scale focused on long-term value.

The Role: Senior Software Engineer

As a Senior Software Engineer on the core Aries engineering team, you’ll play a key role in designing and building the foundational systems that power our platform — enabling fast iteration, deep visibility, and scalable growth across our SaaS portfolio.

This is a hands-on role for a technical builder who’s excited to solve high-leverage challenges, prototype experimental tools, and contribute meaningfully to our engineering culture. You’ll work alongside a small, senior team and collaborate closely with product, data, and AI functions.

What You’ll Do:

  • Build Core Infrastructure: Design and develop internal tools, APIs, and agents that integrate data, systems, and workflows across our SaaS group.

  • Prototype with Purpose: Quickly turn high-level ideas into working products and iterate based on business feedback.

  • Engineer Growth Systems: Build tools that support GTM agents, automate workflows, and enable better decision-making at scale.

  • Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Work closely with product managers, data scientists, and AI engineers to deliver real business impact.

  • Integrate & Stitch Systems: Connect 3rd-party APIs and internal services via clean interfaces and stateful pipelines.

  • Champion Code Quality: Write clean, maintainable, well-tested code while mentoring others on engineering best practices.

What We’re Looking For:

  • 4+ years of experience building backend systems, AI agents, APIs, or infrastructure in modern programming languages (Python, Ruby-on-Rails, TypeScript, Go, etc.)

  • Comfortable working in fast-paced environments with shifting priorities and high autonomy

  • Experience building integrations, internal tools, or platform services

  • Strong product sense: you care about what you’re building and how it helps the business

  • Solid understanding of system design, async workflows, and cloud infrastructure (bonus: experience with agent-based architectures or state machines)

  • Enthusiastic about learning, growing, and collaborating across disciplines

Why This Role?

  • Join an elite founding engineering team with massive ownership and impact

  • Build real systems used across a portfolio of profitable SaaS companies

  • Work at the frontier of product, data, AI, and growth — all in one environment

  • Help shape the culture and direction of a fast-moving, well-funded platform business

Let’s Build

If you’re excited by the idea of building from 0→1, solving real-world problems, and shaping a world-class engineering org — we’d love to hear from you.

Apply now or reach out for an informal chat.
jobs.descriptionPlain:
About Aries

Aries is a rapidly-scaling, next-generation software group purpose-built to scale founder-led, mission-critical SaaS companies at the heart of the $50B+ cloud ecosystem. We unify niche B2B SaaS businesses under Aries' AI and Growth Platform - unlocking visibility, velocity, and value across our portfolio. With a permanent capital base and ~$200M invested annually, we’re building a new model for software scale focused on long-term value.



The Role: Senior Software Engineer

As a Senior Software Engineer on the core Aries engineering team, you’ll play a key role in designing and building the foundational systems that power our platform — enabling fast iteration, deep visibility, and scalable growth across our SaaS portfolio.

This is a hands-on role for a technical builder who’s excited to solve high-leverage challenges, prototype experimental tools, and contribute meaningfully to our engineering culture. You’ll work alongside a small, senior team and collaborate closely with product, data, and AI functions.

What You’ll Do:

 - Build Core Infrastructure: Design and develop internal tools, APIs, and agents that integrate data, systems, and workflows across our SaaS group.

 - Prototype with Purpose: Quickly turn high-level ideas into working products and iterate based on business feedback.

 - Engineer Growth Systems: Build tools that support GTM agents, automate workflows, and enable better decision-making at scale.

 - Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Work closely with product managers, data scientists, and AI engineers to deliver real business impact.

 - Integrate & Stitch Systems: Connect 3rd-party APIs and internal services via clean interfaces and stateful pipelines.

 - Champion Code Quality: Write clean, maintainable, well-tested code while mentoring others on engineering best practices.

What We’re Looking For:

 - 4+ years of experience building backend systems, AI agents, APIs, or infrastructure in modern programming languages (Python, Ruby-on-Rails, TypeScript, Go, etc.)

 - Comfortable working in fast-paced environments with shifting priorities and high autonomy

 - Experience building integrations, internal tools, or platform services

 - Strong product sense: you care about what you’re building and how it helps the business

 - Solid understanding of system design, async workflows, and cloud infrastructure (bonus: experience with agent-based architectures or state machines)

 - Enthusiastic about learning, growing, and collaborating across disciplines

Why This Role?

 - Join an elite founding engineering team with massive ownership and impact

 - Build real systems used across a portfolio of profitable SaaS companies

 - Work at the frontier of product, data, AI, and growth — all in one environment

 - Help shape the culture and direction of a fast-moving, well-funded platform business

Let’s Build

If you’re excited by the idea of building from 0→1, solving real-world problems, and shaping a world-class engineering org — we’d love to hear from you.

Apply now or reach out for an informal chat.

jobs.title: Investment Intern
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Aries

Aries is a rapidly-scaling, next-generation software group purpose-built to scale founder-led, mission-critical SaaS companies at the heart of the $50B+ cloud ecosystem. We unify niche B2B SaaS businesses under Aries' AI and Growth Platform - unlocking visibility, velocity, and value across our portfolio. With a permanent capital base and ~$200M invested annually, we’re building a new model for software scale focused on long-term value.

The Role

We are seeking an intellectually curious and detail-oriented Investment Intern to join our London team. This person will work directly with members of our deal team to build out our acquisition pipeline. This internship is ideal for individuals in the final years of their university studies or recent graduates who have relevant experience in investment banking, venture capital, private equity, consulting, or banking. Experience working in a software company is a plus.

Key Responsibilities

· Identify and evaluate potential software opportunities across our target investment themes

· Map and analyse software market segments to inform our thesis-driven sourcing

· Conduct financial modelling, market research, competitor benchmarking, and valuation work for target companies

· Support deep-dive market research and intelligence

· Assist in preparation of investment memos, board materials, and IC presentations

· Assist in commercial, technical, and financial diligence due diligence process

· Coordinate with advisors and internal teams to structure transactions

· Prepare and consolidate due diligence findings and reports to support the investment team in decision-making.

What We’re Looking For

· Pursuing or recently completed a degree in Finance, Economics, Business, or a related field

· Prior internships in investment banking, PE/VC, management consulting, or software companies

· Strong aptitude for financial modeling, market analysis, and synthesizing complex data; analytical mindset and natural problem-solver.

· Clear and structured communicator with strong written and verbal skills; highly organized and detail-oriented; comfortable juggling multiple priorities in a dynamic environment.

· Self-starter who thrives in ambiguity, takes ownership, and enjoys diving deep into software categories; proactive team player with a strong work ethic and the ability to work independently.

· Excited to work in a fast-paced, high-growth, entrepreneurial environment.

Why Join Aries:

· Hands-on exposure to how a fast-scaling investment and operations platform is built

· Opportunity to work with an experienced team of operators, engineers, and investors

· Learn how world-class SaaS companies are acquired, integrated, and scaled

· High-trust, high-autonomy environment with real ownership

Let’s Build

If you’re excited to gain hands-on experience in software investing and want to learn how great companies are acquired and scaled - we’d love to hear from you.

Apply now or reach out directly to start the conversation.
